product_name: La Roche-PosayEffaclar Micro-Exfoliating Astringent Toner for Oily Skin
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganHSA/FSA eligibleLa Roche-Posay Effaclar Micro-Exfoliating Astringent Toner for Oily Skin exfoliates and smooths skin texture, while helping to unblock and reduce the look of pores.
details: DetailsBenefitsRemoves excess oil and visibly reduces the look of poresClear and refreshing no rinse formulaDermatologist TestedKey IngredientsLHA: a derivative of salicylic acid, has exfoliating and skin surface renewing propertiesLa Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water: A soothing water sourced in the town of La Roche-Posay in France and a core ingredient in most of our productsFormulated WithoutParabensItem 2620402How To UseStep 1: Dampen cotton with toner and apply gently to the face morning and/or evening. Avoid the eye area.Step 2: Add a daily Face Moisturizer that helps absorb oil for all-day matte skinStep 3: Add a Face Sunscreen, La Roche-Posay Anthelios Clear Skin SPF 60 for sun protection.Precautions: Avoid the eye area.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Alcohol Denat., Glycerin, Sodium Citrate, Propylene Glycol, Disodium Edta, Capryloyl Salicylic Acid, Citric Acid, Parfum / Fragrance.
how_to_use: Step 1: Dampen cotton with toner and apply gently to the face morning and/or evening. Avoid the eye area.Step 2: Add a daily Face Moisturizer that helps absorb oil for all-day matte skinStep 3: Add a Face Sunscreen, La Roche-Posay Anthelios Clear Skin SPF 60 for sun protection.Precautions: Avoid the eye area.

reviews.headline: great product!
reviews.comments: Coming from someone whose had their face frozen a few times: this product is now a staple in my facial routine. This stuff works so well without burning or drying out my face.

reviews.headline: Not good for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: This product broke my face out more than anything. It left my face feeling oily. I have sensetive skin and was told/ did my research on how this product was supposed to be good for sesetive skin, but that was not the case for me.

reviews.headline: Wet nice
reviews.comments: I liked this it didnt make me oily after and my skin felt smooth and supple. Also it lasts a while so great for the wallet

reviews.headline: Impressed
reviews.comments: I have oily/acne prone skin with large pores and honestly after a few uses, my skin appears smoother and my pores look smaller. I will continue to incorporate this into my routine.

reviews.headline: I really like this product and will buy again
reviews.comments: I bought this product before in London and it worked very well. I mean I dont have any complaints and my skin never got bad. I tottally recommend and will be buying again

reviews.headline: absolutely love it
reviews.comments: every time i put this on my face, lot of dirts come off and this is the brand i have been looking for!

reviews.headline: Gentle toner
reviews.comments: This is probably my favorite toner for my skin. I have tried a lot in the past and this is gentle, soothing, and definitely helps with pores. This doesn't sting like harsh alcohol toners. It is perfect for my oily, sensitive, acne-prone skin.

reviews.headline: Amazing product for reducing pore size
reviews.comments:
I started using this product when i noticed i had large pores on my nose and around my nose under my eyes. 
After using this product, your skin instantly feels tighter and more refreshed. It might sting a little after using it, but it's completely tollerable. 
After using this product for three or four weeks, i've noticed that my pores are dramatically minimized. I also noticed that it helped clear away some of my blackheads on my nose, but most of them are still there.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I've been a user of a department store brand toner for over 40 years, and it worked well. But, I found as I entered my 60's, my skin was becoming dryer ( I've had oily skin, without many breakouts, all my life. Upside? No wrinkles). This particular toner didn't help anymore.
I started using La Roche-Posay products last year...micellar warer, various cleansers..and liked them. Decided to give this toner a try.
In a word..wonderful! It's lightweight, non-drying. Makes my skin feel clean, and that I've gotten rid of every last trace of cleanser. 
It has a water-like feel to it, which is what I love about it.
I've tried other brands' "gentle" toners. All of them left a film on my face. This one does not.
My only complaint is that it doesn't come in a larger size. I go through a bottle a month!
Like I mentioned, I was a dedicated customer of another brand for over 40 years. Not anymore. La Roche-Posay is my new "go-to" brand for skin care.
faceoff_positive.headline: Great toner

faceoff_negative.comments:
I have a combination skin with my forehead and nose becoming extremely oily. I bought effeclar toner and a mattifying cream. what do you think? I woke up in the morning and my forehead was soaked in oil! I am trying this product for a week right now and the result is the same - very oily skin. 
I remember I bought misellar water a couple of years ago and it did make my skin less oily. I thought other products will work well too. 
I guess I was mistaken.
faceoff_negative.headline: Unexpected result

rollup.name: Effaclar Micro-Exfoliating Astringent Toner for Oily Skin
